alert.note: Alert for Petersburg Borough (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 12 at 8:00PM AKST until December 13 at 3:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The following area, Central Inner Channels along the Mitkof Highway. * WHEN...Until 800 AM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 756 PM AKST, river gauge reports indicate rises in water levels from heavy rain in the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 0.75 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.1-0.2 inches in 5 hours. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Other ungauged streams in the area maybe also expanding to near or above bankfull level leading to potential minor flooding. - For Falls Creek near Petersburg: At 7:00pm the stage was 21.56 feet. Flood Stage is 22.5 feet.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
